title: Russian drone hits bus in Kharkiv region, injuring six, official says
content: A Russian drone attack in Ukraine's northeastern Kharkiv region on Friday injured six construction workers, with one critically injured, according to the regional governor. The incident occurred near Derhachi, close to where Russia began a new offensive in May. Ukraine halted the advance with reinforcements after Russia pushed into the border areas.
summary: A Russian drone attack in Ukraine's northeastern Kharkiv region on Friday injured six construction workers, with one critically injured, according to the regional governor. The incident occurred near Derhachi, close to where Russia began a new offensive in May. Ukraine halted the advance with reinforcements after Russia pushed into the border areas.

title: European Holocaust Remembrance Day for Sinti and Roma
content: In 1944, Nazi forces executed around 4,300 Sinti and Roma prisoners in Auschwitz-Birkenau, marking the end of the 'gypsy camp.' The European Union commemorates this event on August 2 as the European Roma Holocaust Memorial Day. Survivors like Christian Pfeil continue to share their stories, emphasizing the importance of remembering this genocide to prevent history from repeating itself.

Turkey bans Instagram without explanation
content: Turkey blocked Instagram without explanation following accusations of censorship by Turkish communications official Fahrettin Altun. Altun claimed Instagram impeded condolence posts for Hamas official Ismail Haniyeh, killed in Tehran. The Turkish Information Technologies and Communication Authority announced the block, affecting over 50 million Turkish Instagram users. Meta Platforms has not commented on the issue.

How Joe Biden persuaded German Chancellor Scholz to release a top Kremlin assassin
content: The release of US journalist Evan Gershkovich and 15 others in a historic prisoner swap was facilitated by a personal promise from German Chancellor Olaf Scholz to Biden during a visit to the White House. The plan, discussed on February 9, involved Biden asking Scholz to release Vadim Krasikov, a convicted Russian murderer serving a life sentence in Germany, as part of a complex arrangement involving six countries.
